results.description:
This month we welcome Paul Smith (@findSanctuary) and Andrew Seward (@MrAndrew) to the Tech Nottingham stage - Plus we've got free food and drinks provided at the event thanks to our sponsors.

No tickets required, just turn up - it's free!

Full event details can be found here: http://www.technottingham.com/events/2017/1/9/jan17

The talks are as follows:

How to Thrive in an Environment of Change and Uncertainty
by Paul Smith

The environments we live and work in are always changing. Whilst positive change is often welcomed, we can sometimes become defensive in the face of a threat or sudden transition. Change is always subjective, whether to circumstance or person; changes such as project scope or requirements, a change in job role or responsibilities or even a change that threatens our job security.

When shifts like this happen we can often feel like we're not in control of our emotional response. As we explore change and its emotional consequence, we'll look at a model that's easy to remember and apply. One that will enable you to assess your reaction when presented with change. We'll learn why we find change difficult and how, once aware, we can change the way we respond to it.


About Paul

I'm the team lead for the web team at Esendex. I also like recording podcasts and doing talks about emotional intelligence, helping people to live healthier and happier!

How to Talk: A guide to giving talks, presentations and public speaking
by Andrew Seward

Are you nervous about speaking in front of others? Do you find yourself bashing out a powerpoint presentation the night before and hoping for the best? What you need is this crash course in preparing and giving great talks and presentations. Whether they be at work, at meetups or conferences, in 30 minutes Andrew Seward (@MrAndrew) will guide you through the finer points of putting together and delivering great presentations. We’ll also cover some good ideas for maximising the exposure when your talk is one of dozens on a conference schedule.


About Andrew

Andrew (@MrAndrew) is Head of Product at Cronofy and organiser of Tech Nottingham and Hack24. He's been working in software in various capacities for 12 years and these days he tends to product manage APIs. He also runs, cycles and keeps bees.


Full event details can be found here:

http://www.technottingham.com/events/2017/1/9/jan17


Never miss an event! Join our mailing list
results.name: Tech Nottingham January 2017 - Starting fresh this New Year!

venue.address_1: The Poynt Building, 45 Wollaton Street, NG1 5FW
venue.name: Accelerate Places Nottingham

results.description:
At Tech Nottingham we are very pleased to announce our new morning event Tech on Toast.

Come along before work to get a free breakfast, to hear some of Nottingham's brightest talk about their companies and their projects and to socialise with the other members of the local tech community.

We'll be serving a range of breakfast options in a relaxed environment and all are welcome, regardless of technical background.

No tickets required, just turn up - It's free!

What’s on this month? January’s Tech on Toast will feature two brilliant talks from the local tech community - To be announced soon! Each talk is short and snappy; designed to kick-start conversation and give you some tangible ideas to take away.

The Venue Tech on Toast is held at the awesome Accelerate Places on Wollaton Street, near the Theatre Royal in Nottingham City Centre. With a top-notch cafe and amphitheatre style seating; it’s the perfect venue in which to spend your morning.

The DateTime The next event starts at 7.30am on Wednesday 18th January - After that, it’s the third Wednesday of every month. We’ll see you there!

Full event details can be found here:

http://www.technottingham.com/events/2016/01/18/tech-on-toast-january-2017


Never miss an event! Join our mailing list
